name: washing machine production | washing machine | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21909/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average washing machine which is 75 kg in mass. It has the envisaged lifetime of 10 years and is manufactured in China.The figures on material inputs from technosphere and electricity required to produce an average washing machine are taken from Yuan et al. 2016. The figure on the annual production volume is estimated via GDP scaling. This is based on the annual amount of washing machine sales in EU as taken from Michel et al. 2015. 

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory.

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing an average washing machine. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/275:Manufacture of domestic appliances/2750:Manufacture of domestic appliances

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to primary data from 2004. Although the background study utilised in this project (Yuan et al. 2016) was published in 2016, it refers to technology described as being 'current'.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average washing macine. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in China.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in China.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The figure on the annual world production volume is extrapolated from the  annual volume of washing machines sold in EU. According to Michel, A., Josephy, B., Bush, E., et al. 2015. Monitoring the washing machines market in Europe. Discussion paper. Available from: http://www.topten.eu/uploads/File/EEDAL15_Anette_Michel_Monitoring_washing_machines_market.pdf (Accessed 20 January 2018), the annual sales of washing machines in EU in 2014 were equal to15.2 million units. Then gross domestic product (GDP) at current prices (or GDP at prices of the current reporting period), also known as nominal GDP, was used. The EU controbution to global GDP in 2014 is 23.8% (Source: Eurostat 2016. The EU in the world - economy and finance. Available from: http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/statistics-explained/index.php/The_EU_in_the_world_-_economy_and_finance (Accessed 14 January 2018). Consequently, the global production volume of washing machines can be estimated as 15.2 million x 100 / 23.8 = 63.87 million units.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Yuan et al. 2016. Data on the annual production volume are taken from Michel et al. 2015. Sources: Yuan, Z., Zhang, Y., and Liu, X., 2016. Life cycle assessment of horizontal-axis washing machines in China. International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment, 21, 15-28. Michel, A., Josephy, B., Bush, E., et al. 2015. Monitoring the washing machines market in Europe. Discussion paper. Available from: http://www.topten.eu/uploads/File/EEDAL15_Anette_Michel_Monitoring_washing_machines_market.pdf (Accessed 20 January 2018).

exchanges.description: Estimated value.The input of infrastructure is approximated with the exchange 'metal working factory', this was chosen as metal is the main material constituting the final product. The general comment for the activity 'metal working faculty, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018] specifies: '4.58E-10 units of this process are needed to produce 1 kg of final product. Additionally, the dataset for 'metal working factory' needs to be used together with the 'energy and auxilliary inputs, metal working factory', 1 kg of this exchange is required per 1 kg of final product.

exchanges.description: Estimated value.The input of infrastructure is approximated with the exchange 'metal working factory', this was chosen as metal is the main material constituting the final product. The general comment for the activity 'metal working faculty, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018] specifies: '4.58E-10 units of this process are needed to produce 1 kg of final product. Additionally, the dataset for 'metal working factory' needs to be used together with the 'energy and auxilliary inputs, metal working factory', 1 kg of this exchange is required per 1 kg of final product.
